name: TMBG's Guest and Backing Musicians Online Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was TMBG's  first guest drummer, appearing on "Lie Still, Little Bottle"?
questions.explanation:
Kenneth Nolan.

	Alan Bezozi played drums on several tracks from the album "Flood",  Jim Thomas played drums on "She's Actual Size" from the album "Apollo 18" and Zak Alford played drums on "Dr. Worm" from "Severe Tire Damage".

questions.text: Which of the following musicians does not belong with the other three?
questions.explanation:
Dan Levine.

	The other three musicians have played trumpet with TMBG.  Levine plays trombone and has played with TMBG at many live shows.

questions.text: TMBG's first album with a full backing band was "John Henry", released in 1994.  Who played bass guitar on this album?
questions.explanation:
Tony Maimone.

	The other three have also played bass with TMBG.

questions.text: Who of these choices has NOT played lead guitar for TMBG?
questions.explanation:
Kurt Hoffman.

	Kurt Hoffman was a member of TMBG's first backing band, but playing horns, not guitar.

questions.text: From 1999 to 2004, TMBG toured and recorded with the Band of Dans, three musicians all named Dan.  Which of these was NOT a member of the Band of Dans?
questions.explanation:
Dan Levine.

	This made the band members' names John (Flansburgh), John (Linnell), Dan, Dan, and Dan.  As Flansburgh said at a live show:  "It's a full house... every night."

questions.text: Eugene Chadbourne was one of TMBG's earliest guest musicians.  He played a guitar solo on what song from their debut album, "They Might Be Giants"?
questions.explanation:
Absolutely Bill's Mood.

	He made a phone call from North Carolina to their studio in New York City, leaving the solo as an answering machine message.

questions.text: Who is not a member of TMBG's "Other Thing", a mini brass ensemble that occasionally backs the band?
questions.explanation:
Jim O'Conner.

	The Other Thing also features Marty Beller on drums and desk bell.  It has only been featured in a handful of shows and songs.

questions.text: The song "Boat of Car" from They Might Be Giants' self-titled debut album features a guest vocalist.  Who is it?
questions.explanation:
Margaret Seiler.

	The song also features a sample from the Johnny Cash song "Daddy Sang Bass".

questions.text: They Might Be Giants' children's album "No!" features a song called "Where Do They Make Balloons?" written and sung by which musician, a member of the Band of Dans?
questions.explanation:
Danny Weinkauf.

	Mr. Weinkauf plays the bass, and continues to tour and record with TMBG.

questions.text: The wife of John Flansburgh (singer/guitarist) has sung on several TMBG songs.  What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Robin Goldwasser.

	Ms. Goldwasser is also the co-creater of the musical "People are Wrong!" which stars Flansburgh.
